717283f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from West 3rd Street, showing prominently the Grand Central Hotel at Nos. 665-677. The Southern Hotel, as shown bears No. 679 and adjoins the 32,-story corner structure, No. 68l. Around 1890 the Crand Central became known as the Broadway Central. It stands upon the site of the famous La Farge House. "Boss" Tweed was at one time
financially interested in this enterprise.
About 1870:
Gift of H.D. ;ewett.

717281f-a.text:
66777 Broadway, west side, south of W. 3rd Street,
(right, not seen), showing a view of the Broadway Central Wotel. The photographer is at Bond Street and he is viewing northwestward.
About 1910
D7ift of Urbrock Collection

724420f-a.text:
553, 557, 563 West Broadway, adjcining the S.E. corner of West 3rd Street. The garage at the right was built since 1922, replacing the old houses 551, 553, 555 (formerly 21, 19, 17 South Fifth Avenue). The older Black Cat Restaurant ('Au Chat Noir"), was
in No. 551.
February 19, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

724421f-a.text:
West Broadway, (formerly South Fifth Avenue), south from a point, to the south of West 3rd Street (formerly Amity Street), showing this thoroughfare darkened by the old Sixth Avenue "El." View 2 is the area subsequent to the demolition of same, amphasizes the structures on the westerly side. To the left appears the sign advertising the Black Cat, cabaret
and restauranf.
View 1: August 27, 1933
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

West Broadway, (formerly South Fifth Avenue), south from a point, to the south of West 3rd Street (formerly Amity Street), showing this thoroughfare darkened by the old Sixth Avenue "El." 717285f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, south from and including West 3rd Street. The Broadway Central Hotel, Nos. 667-677, occupies a 7-story building, just south of the corner. 3rd Street, when east of Broadway, is called Great Jones Street, until it crosses the Bowery, where it becomes East 3rd Street. Ehe 10-story structdre shown on the extreme left, is No. 682 Broadway, and is at the S.E.
corner of Great Jones Street.
June 23, 1936.
P. L, Sperr.
(2)
A view solely of the S.W. corner of West 3rd Street.
June 23, 1936.
L. Sperr.

710876f-a.text:
60 West 3rd Street, at the S.E. conner of West Broadway (right) showing the Pioneer Restaurant occupying the lower portion of an old residence.. At the right is the curve of the old Sixth Avenue "E11
This was demolished in 1939
May 5, 1937
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project

724422f-c.text:
West Broadway, north from a point (No. 557) slightly south of West 3rd Street and across same to Washington Square. The "Black Cat," a night club, is at No. 557 Nest Broadway and adjoins the 28-story structure at the S.E. corner. View No. 3 shows this feature solely. In the background of View 1 apoears the distinctive apartment dwelling, No.. 1 Fifth Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Eaet 8th Street. The earlier view of this set was photographed immediately following the "E1"
demolition.
View 1: April 5, 1939
Views 2, 3: October 14, 1939
P. L. Sperr
